main.selfIntro: I'm Jin Hung Chin, transitioning from a Geologist to a Computer and Information Systems graduate. My passion for programming and hands-on experience in front-end and full-stack MERN development, combined with my formal education from Douglas College, have prepared me to contribute effectively in the realm of application development.
main.background:
I began my professional journey as a Formation Evaluation Geologist in the Oil and Gas sector, where my role involved the daily management of significant operational data. This experience sparked my initial interest in SQL programming, and later leading me to delve into other programming languages. Over time, my fascination with coding grew, and I started to independently study and enhance my programming skills. 
Fortuitously, I was given an opportunity to explore this passion further by joining a company as a Front End Developer. This role allowed me to utilize my newly-acquired skills in a practical environment, but I knew I wanted to delve deeper and solidify my theoretical understanding. 
When the Covid-19 pandemic broke out in 2020, it offered an unexpected opportunity to further my education. I seized this chance to systematically learn programming, enrolling in the Computing and System Information course at Douglas College. Recently, I celebrated my graduation and now, equipped with both practical experience and formal education, I am eagerly anticipating my journey ahead in the world of programming. 
I am now transformed from a Geologist who knew little about coding, to a full-fledged programmer ready to make my mark in the tech industry.
